articles.author: Sue Lannin
articles.title: Wall Street rallies after UK backflip on tax cuts and Bank of America's earnings rise - ABC News
articles.description: US stocks rallied overnight after the UK Government ditched major parts of its economic plan that caused turmoil in financial markets and the Bank of America posted stronger earnings.
articles.content:
Wall Street has surged after the UK reversed course on its mini budget, which had caused chaos in financial markets, and after strong Bank of America earnings drove a relief rally.

articles.title: Biden launches student loan forgiveness application - CNN
articles.description: President Joe Biden on Monday announced the formal launch of the federal application for Americans seeking student loan forgiveness, the latest phase of his plan that is expected to provide debt relief to as many as 43 million borrowers.

articles.title: What would a Kroger-Albertsons merger mean for grocery prices? - CNN
articles.description: In a mega-deal that could have a huge impact on grocery shopping in America, Kroger and Albertsons announced Friday plans to merge.
articles.content:

articles.title: Kanye West to buy social media platform Parler - CBC News
articles.description: U.S. rapper Kanye West, who now goes by Ye, has proposed buying Parler, the social media platform popular among American conservatives, parent Parlement Technologies said on Monday.

articles.title: Beck drops out as opening act for Arcade Fire's North American leg of tour - CBC News
articles.description: Live Nation confirms American musician Beck will no longer be opening for the North American leg of Arcade Fire's We tour, which begins end of October, amid sexual misconduct allegations against the band's lead singer.
